messages: a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:12): Hi. I've just downloaded blender, upon advice from several of my friends, but I am experiencing some really weird artifacts while using the interface
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:12): for example, clicking on menus will make a quater of them disappear
f475fc972b766c85d9c2dd5f4d320994 (12:13): sounds like graphics card / driver problems...
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:13): When I collapse menus, the animation of the menu collapsing plays, but the menu appears to work
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:13): I'm using a geforce 6800 and the latest directx
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:13): what is your video card?
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:13): what about your drivers?
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:13): about 3 months old or so
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:14): I experience no problems in computer games
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:14): but games have nothing to do with Blender
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:14): hmm.. they should work.
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:14): what OS are you using?
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:14): windows XP
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:14): wait. dumb question
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:15): directx... duh. hehe
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:15): admiralsenn: games use hardware acceleration, blender uses hardware acceleration (I assume)
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:15): are you using the official nvidia drivers or some pretweaked ones like DNA?
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:15): not... really
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:15): the official ones
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:16): Blender is free and open source, they don't have the budget to pay for the stuff they'd need for hardware acceleration
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:16): have you modified any  openGL settings in the drivers?
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:16): aha!
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:16): apparently the cursor shadow can cause problems and weird artifacts
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:16): from http://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?t=13255
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:16): that will do it too sometimes.
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:16): there you go
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:21): well I disabled the shadow but it's still causing problems
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:21): have you altered any openGL settings in the video settings?
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:21): no
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:22): also check to make sure forced AA and AF is off
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:22): I don't think I even have any games that use opengl
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:22): where would I check for that?
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:22): have you ever teaked the drivers at all?
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:22): it does weird things to Blender if those are on constantly
0a97748add8cb61b9fe82a1ccd1292f6 (12:22): if you don't know, they're probably off
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:22): no, I don't really do stuff like that
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:22): if things work, it's good enough for me
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:23): ok, for the time being, update your drivers. do a fresh install though. so uninstall teh old ones, reboot, then install the new ones.
e27f2d98e6fdef04e761461fc89c866e (12:24): this way we know you are starting from scratch.
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (12:24): okidoke
